basics.name: Alexis Besson
basics.headline: Senior Software Engineer
basics.summary: I bridge technical and business teams through deep product vision. Fueled by exploring complex challenges, I leverage my expertise to strengthen digital teams in forward-thinking companies.

awards.title: Potential EUDI Consortium Hackathon Winner
awards.summary: 48h hackathon to interop our team between Issuer (my role), Identity Wallet and Verifier in order to make working a complete SSI flow, including revocation.

projects.name: SSI Wallet Interop. Tool
projects.description: Help identity wallet providers interoperate with each other by providing challenges based on the OpenID4VC draft and specification.

work.description: Since the deployment of the Archipels wallet, my role also took on a managerial orientation, with <mark>responsibility for delivery</mark> and implementing the necessary processes to ensure consistent velocity, as well as optimal quality and maintainability. We also worked on implementing another credential exchange protocol more aligned with EUDIW recommendations. I took charge of implementing these new protocols as well as the <mark>responsibility for our interoperability </mark> with other actors in the SSI ecosystem.

Archipels specially had a very interesting product where I discovered a new functional domain. Self-Sovereign Identity (SSI) aims to address numerous societal problems, and the underlying technologies are fascinating. Initially, I joined Archipels as a senior software engineer to implement a web identity & organization wallet, designed for individuals but especially for businesses.

FDJ (Francaise des Jeux) group entrusted Polyconseil with the design and development of its Nirio application, the new <mark>payment service</mark> of the group. It is in this context that I came to reinforce Polyconseil's technical teams at the beginning of the adventure. I mainly worked on the <mark>authentication</mark>, the user <mark>onboarding workflow</mark>, the synchronization of the points of sales with the FDJ group's IS, and end-to-end tests with the mobile application.

Within the digital team of the Boiron group, I participated in the maintenance and evolution of a professional portal made available to health professionals in order to provide information on the products of the group.

Through the ‚ÄúECAT‚Äù project, Carrier offers me the opportunity to take again the <mark>technical responsibility</mark> of a project <mark>from design to production</mark>. On this application, most of data come from a calculation engine built by a team in the US. All the functional rules come from a factory in Spain, the application is integrated in a more global framework developed in India and the development team is in Lyon (France). This project has a very <mark>pronounced business aspect</mark> (thermodynamics) and therefore brings together many international players. Beyond the technical challenge, this experience requires a permanent orchestration of the different actors in a 100% <mark>English speaking environment</mark>.

At Homeserve, I joined the ‚ÄúHomeServe ‚Äì OnDemand‚Äù product development team in an agile environment (Scrum). I participated in the stabilization of a particularly <mark>complex architecture</mark> implementing several micro-services => Addition of many unit tests (Jest). During this experience, I discovered the benefits of a strongly typed language (Typescript), as well as an alternative frontend (VueJS), and backend (Hapi).

Through the ESN ‚ÄúUmlaut‚Äù, I had the opportunity to <mark>develop from scratch</mark> a solution for the car manufacturer Renault. Design, implementation and migration to the new architecture of a vehicle test sessions management tool. Development of new functionalities on the tool in an Agile environment (Scrum) to go <mark>from a prototype to a final application</mark>. Implementation of the client part of a Dashboard prototype (visualization of different KPIs using dynamic graphs). English speaking environment.

Within a <mark>rigorous agile environment</mark> (scrum) I integrated for 18 months the development team of the B2B vertical of Allocine where I found a strong technical ecosystem, including Graphql which fits so well the needs of component-oriented front-end libraries, facilitates maintenance, readability and evolution of backend code. One of the most interesting challenge was the <mark>quantity of data</mark> to process and the need to optimize the performances of queries.

Internship (half school / half company). Within a team of 10 people, I participated in the development of the visualization interface of a satellite control center (ISIS project), with the permanent problem of <mark>performances optimization</mark>.
